content.en: Microscopy algorithms: Deep learning algorithms are being used to extend the range of observable biological phenomena in fluorescence microscopy, accelerate image deconvolution and fusion in optical microscopy, and improve super-resolution imaging. These algorithms are also facilitating the utilization of deep learning for optical microscopy and enhancing the spatial resolution of biomedical imaging. Additionally, algorithms such as residual channel attention networks and physics-informed neural networks are being employed for denoising, sharpening, and reconstructing microscopy images, while transfer learning enables fast and universal reconstruction of structured illumination microscopy images. Overall, the incorporation of algorithms into microscopy techniques is improving the quality and efficiency of image analysis in scientific research.
content.da: Mikroskopialgoritmer: Deep learning-algoritmer bliver anvendt til at udvide rækken af observerbare biologiske fænomener i fluorescensmikroskopi, accelerere billeddekonvolution og fusion i optisk mikroskopi og forbedre superopløsningsafbildning. Disse algoritmer letter også anvendelsen af deep learning til optisk mikroskopi og øger den rumlige opløsning af biomedicinsk billeddannelse. Desuden anvendes algoritmer som residual channel attention networks og fysikinformerede neurale netværk til støjreduktion, skarphed og rekonstruktion af mikroskopibilleder, mens transfer learning muliggør hurtig og universel rekonstruktion af struktureret belysningsmikroskopi-billeder. Samlet set forbedrer inkorporationen af algoritmer i mikroskopiteknikker kvaliteten og effektiviteten af billedanalyse i videnskabelig forskning.
